001package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
007
008import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
009import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
010
011/**
012 * Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a real matrix.
013 * This code has been ported from https://math.nist.gov/javanumerics/jama/ (Version 1.0.3), with the
014 * public API (and some internals) adapted to Apache Commons Math (by W. Burger). 
015 * This is intended as a temporary substitute for Apache Commons Math's own implementation
016 * of Eigenvalue decomposition, which behaves strangely at times. 
017 * Most comments below were taken from the original sources.
018 * <p>
019 * If A is symmetric, then A = V*D*V' where the eigenvalue matrix D is diagonal
020 * and the eigenvector matrix V is orthogonal. I.e. A =
021 * V.times(D.times(V.transpose())) and V.times(V.transpose()) equals the
022 * identity matrix.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * If A is not symmetric, then the eigenvalue matrix D is block diagonal with
026 * the real eigenvalues in 1-by-1 blocks and any complex eigenvalues, lambda +
027 * i*mu, in 2-by-2 blocks, [lambda, mu; -mu, lambda]. The columns of V represent
028 * the eigenvectors in the sense that A*V = V*D, i.e. A.times(V) equals
029 * V.times(D). The matrix V may be badly conditioned, or even singular, so the
030 * validity of the equation A = V*D*inverse(V) depends upon V.cond().
031 * </p>
032 **/
033
034public class EigenvalueDecomposition {
035        
036        private final static double SymmetryTolerance = 1e-6;
037        private final static double EPSILON = 1e-12;
038
039        private final int n;                    // Row and column dimension (square matrix).
040        private final boolean issymmetric;      // Symmetry flag.
041        private final double[] d;               // real parts of eigenvalues.
042        private final double[] e;               // imaginary parts of eigenvalues.
043        private final double[][] V;             // Array for internal storage of eigenvectors.
044        
045        private double[][] H;                   // Array for internal storage of nonsymmetric Hessenberg form.
046        private double[] ort;                   // Working storage for nonsymmetric algorithm.
047
048        /**
049         * Constructor. 
050         * Checks for symmetry, then constructs the eigenvalue decomposition.
051         *
052         * @param M a square matrix
053         */
054        public EigenvalueDecomposition(final RealMatrix M) {
055                final double[][] A = M.getData();
056                this.n = M.getColumnDimension();
057                this.V = new double[n][n];
058                this.d = new double[n];
059                this.e = new double[n];
060                
061                this.issymmetric = MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(M, SymmetryTolerance);
062
063//              issymmetric = true;
064//              for (int j = 0; (j < n) & issymmetric; j++) {
065//                      for (int i = 0; (i < n) & issymmetric; i++) {
066//                              issymmetric = (A[i][j] == A[j][i]);
067//                      }
068//              }
069
070                if (issymmetric) {
071                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
072                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
073                                        V[i][j] = A[i][j];
074                                }
075                        }
076                        tred2();        // Tridiagonalize.
077                        tql2();         // Diagonalize.
078
079                } else {
080                        this.H = new double[n][n];
081                        this.ort = new double[n];
082                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
083                                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
084                                        H[i][j] = A[i][j];
085                                }
086                        }
087                        orthes();       // Reduce to Hessenberg form.
088                        hqr2();         // Reduce Hessenberg to real Schur form.
089                }
090        }
091        
092        // ------------------------ Public Methods ------------------------
093
094        /**
095         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
096         * vectors.
097         * 
098         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
099         */
100        public RealMatrix getV() {
101                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Return the transpose of the eigenvector matrix.
106         * The eigenvectors are the rows of the returned matrix.
107         * 
108         * @return the transposed matrix of eigenvectors
109         */
110        public RealMatrix getVT() {
111                RealMatrix v = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
112                return v.transpose();
113        }
114        
115         /**
116     * Returns a copy of the specified eigenvector, i.e., the
117     * associated column vector of the matrix returned
118     * by {@link #getV()}.
119     * 
120     * @param k index of the eigenvector (counting from 0).
121     * @return a copy of the k-th eigenvector
122     */
123    public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
124        double[] ev = new double[n];
125        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
126                ev[i] = V[i][k];
127        }
128        return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ev);
129    }
130
131        /**
132         * Return the real parts of the eigenvalues
133         * @return real(diag(D))
134         */
135        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
136                return d;
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
141         * @return imag(diag(D))
142         */
143        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
144                return e;
145        }
146        
147        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
148                return d[k];
149        }
150        
151        public double getImagEigenvalue(int k) {
152                return e[k];
153        }
154        
155    /**
156     * Returns whether the calculated eigen values are complex or real.
157     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
158     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
159     * element is not equal to zero.
160     *
161     * @return {@code true} if the eigenvalues are complex, {@code false} otherwise
162     */
163    public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
164        for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
165            if (Math.abs(e[i]) > EPSILON) {
166                return true;
167            }
168        }
169        return false;
170    }
171        
172//      /**
173//       * Return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
174//       * @return D
175//   * WB: don't understand -- index problem??
176//       */
177//      public RealMatrix getD() {
178//              final double[][] D = new double[n][n];
179//              for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
180//                      for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
181//                              D[i][j] = 0.0;
182//                      }
183//                      D[i][i] = d[i];
184//                      if (e[i] > 0) {
185//                              D[i][i + 1] = e[i];
186//                      } else if (e[i] < 0) {
187//                              D[i][i - 1] = e[i];
188//                      }
189//              }
190//              return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(D);
191//      }
192    
193    /**
194     * Gets the block diagonal matrix D of the decomposition.
195     * D is a block diagonal matrix.
196     * Real eigenvalues are on the diagonal while complex values are on
197     * 2x2 blocks {{real pos imaginary}, {neg imaginary, real}}.
198     * WB: Wonder if indexes are safe!
199     *
200         * @return D
201         */
202        public RealMatrix getD() {
203                RealMatrix D = MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d);
204                for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
205                        if (e[i] > EPSILON) {
206                                D.setEntry(i, i + 1, e[i]);
207                        } else if (e[i] < -EPSILON) {
208                                D.setEntry(i, i - 1, e[i]);
209                        }
210                }
211                return D;
212        }
213        
214        /**
215     * Calculates and returns the determinant of the matrix.
216     *
217     * @return the determinant of the matrix.
218     */
219    public double getDeterminant() {
220        double determinant = 1.0;
221        for (double lambda : d) {
222            determinant = determinant * lambda;
223        }
224        return determinant;
225    }
226
227        // ------------------------ Private Methods ------------------------
228
229        // Symmetric Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
230        private void tred2() {
231                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tred2 by
232                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
233                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
234                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
235                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
236                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
237                }
238
239                // Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
240                for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) {
241                        // Scale to avoid under/overflow.
242                        double scale = 0.0;
243                        double h = 0.0;
244                        for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
245                                scale = scale + Math.abs(d[k]);
246                        }
247                        if (scale == 0.0) {
248                                e[i] = d[i - 1];
249                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
250                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
251                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
252                                        V[j][i] = 0.0;
253                                }
254                        } else {
255                                // Generate Householder vector.
256                                for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
257                                        d[k] /= scale;
258                                        h += d[k] * d[k];
259                                }
260                                double f = d[i - 1];
261                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
262                                if (f > 0) {
263                                        g = -g;
264                                }
265                                e[i] = scale * g;
266                                h = h - f * g;
267                                d[i - 1] = f - g;
268                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
269                                        e[j] = 0.0;
270                                }
271
272                                // Apply similarity transformation to remaining columns.
273                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
274                                        f = d[j];
275                                        V[j][i] = f;
276                                        g = e[j] + V[j][j] * f;
277                                        for (int k = j + 1; k <= i - 1; k++) {
278                                                g += V[k][j] * d[k];
279                                                e[k] += V[k][j] * f;
280                                        }
281                                        e[j] = g;
282                                }
283                                f = 0.0;
284                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
285                                        e[j] /= h;
286                                        f += e[j] * d[j];
287                                }
288                                final double hh = f / (h + h);
289                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
290                                        e[j] -= hh * d[j];
291                                }
292                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
293                                        f = d[j];
294                                        g = e[j];
295                                        for (int k = j; k <= i - 1; k++) {
296                                                V[k][j] -= (f * e[k] + g * d[k]);
297                                        }
298                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
299                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
300                                }
301                        }
302                        d[i] = h;
303                }
304
305                // Accumulate transformations.
306                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
307                        V[n - 1][i] = V[i][i];
308                        V[i][i] = 1.0;
309                        final double h = d[i + 1];
310                        if (h != 0.0) {
311                                for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
312                                        d[k] = V[k][i + 1] / h;
313                                }
314                                for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
315                                        double g = 0.0;
316                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
317                                                g += V[k][i + 1] * V[k][j];
318                                        }
319                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
320                                                V[k][j] -= g * d[k];
321                                        }
322                                }
323                        }
324                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
325                                V[k][i + 1] = 0.0;
326                        }
327                }
328                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
329                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
330                        V[n - 1][j] = 0.0;
331                }
332                V[n - 1][n - 1] = 1.0;
333                e[0] = 0.0;
334        }
335
336        // Symmetric tridiagonal QL algorithm.
337        private void tql2() {
338                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tql2, by
339                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
340                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
341                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
342                for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
343                        e[i - 1] = e[i];
344                }
345                e[n - 1] = 0.0;
346
347                double f = 0.0;
348                double tst1 = 0.0;
349                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
350                for (int l = 0; l < n; l++) {
351                        // Find small subdiagonal element
352                        tst1 = Math.max(tst1, Math.abs(d[l]) + Math.abs(e[l]));
353                        int m = l;
354                        while (m < n) {
355                                if (Math.abs(e[m]) <= eps * tst1) {
356                                        break;
357                                }
358                                m++;
359                        }
360
361                        // If m == l, d[l] is an eigenvalue,
362                        // otherwise, iterate.
363                        if (m > l) {
364                                int iter = 0;
365                                do {
366                                        iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
367                                        // Compute implicit shift
368                                        double g = d[l];
369                                        double p = (d[l + 1] - g) / (2.0 * e[l]);
370                                        double r = Math.hypot(p, 1.0);
371                                        if (p < 0) {
372                                                r = -r;
373                                        }
374                                        d[l] = e[l] / (p + r);
375                                        d[l + 1] = e[l] * (p + r);
376                                        final double dl1 = d[l + 1];
377                                        double h = g - d[l];
378                                        for (int i = l + 2; i < n; i++) {
379                                                d[i] -= h;
380                                        }
381                                        f = f + h;
382
383                                        // Implicit QL transformation.
384                                        p = d[m];
385                                        double c = 1.0;
386                                        double c2 = c;
387                                        double c3 = c;
388                                        final double el1 = e[l + 1];
389                                        double s = 0.0;
390                                        double s2 = 0.0;
391                                        for (int i = m - 1; i >= l; i--) {
392                                                c3 = c2;
393                                                c2 = c;
394                                                s2 = s;
395                                                g = c * e[i];
396                                                h = c * p;
397                                                r = Math.hypot(p, e[i]);
398                                                e[i + 1] = s * r;
399                                                s = e[i] / r;
400                                                c = p / r;
401                                                p = c * d[i] - s * g;
402                                                d[i + 1] = h + s * (c * g + s * d[i]);
403
404                                                // Accumulate transformation.
405                                                for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
406                                                        h = V[k][i + 1];
407                                                        V[k][i + 1] = s * V[k][i] + c * h;
408                                                        V[k][i] = c * V[k][i] - s * h;
409                                                }
410                                        }
411                                        p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e[l] / dl1;
412                                        e[l] = s * p;
413                                        d[l] = c * p;
414
415                                        // Check for convergence.
416                                } while (Math.abs(e[l]) > eps * tst1);
417                        }
418                        d[l] = d[l] + f;
419                        e[l] = 0.0;
420                }
421
422                // Sort eigenvalues and corresponding vectors.
423                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
424                        int k = i;
425                        double p = d[i];
426                        for (int j = i + 1; j < n; j++) {
427                                if (d[j] < p) {
428                                        k = j;
429                                        p = d[j];
430                                }
431                        }
432                        if (k != i) {
433                                d[k] = d[i];
434                                d[i] = p;
435                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
436                                        p = V[j][i];
437                                        V[j][i] = V[j][k];
438                                        V[j][k] = p;
439                                }
440                        }
441                }
442        }
443
444        // Nonsymmetric reduction to Hessenberg form.
445        private void orthes() {
446                // This is derived from the Algol procedures orthes and ortran,
447                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
448                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
449                // Fortran subroutines in EISPACK.
450                final int low = 0;
451                final int high = n - 1;
452                
453                for (int m = low + 1; m <= high - 1; m++) {
454
455                        // Scale column.
456
457                        double scale = 0.0;
458                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
459                                scale = scale + Math.abs(H[i][m - 1]);
460                        }
461                        if (scale != 0.0) {
462                                // Compute Householder transformation.
463                                double h = 0.0;
464                                for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
465                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1] / scale;
466                                        h += ort[i] * ort[i];
467                                }
468                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
469                                if (ort[m] > 0) {
470                                        g = -g;
471                                }
472                                h = h - ort[m] * g;
473                                ort[m] = ort[m] - g;
474
475                                // Apply Householder similarity transformation
476                                // H = (I-u*u'/h)*H*(I-u*u')/h)
477                                for (int j = m; j < n; j++) {
478                                        double f = 0.0;
479                                        for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
480                                                f += ort[i] * H[i][j];
481                                        }
482                                        f = f / h;
483                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
484                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[i];
485                                        }
486                                }
487
488                                for (int i = 0; i <= high; i++) {
489                                        double f = 0.0;
490                                        for (int j = high; j >= m; j--) {
491                                                f += ort[j] * H[i][j];
492                                        }
493                                        f = f / h;
494                                        for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
495                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[j];
496                                        }
497                                }
498                                ort[m] = scale * ort[m];
499                                H[m][m - 1] = scale * g;
500                        }
501                }
502
503                // Accumulate transformations (Algol's ortran).
504                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
505                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
506                                V[i][j] = (i == j ? 1.0 : 0.0);
507                        }
508                }
509
510                for (int m = high - 1; m >= low + 1; m--) {
511                        if (H[m][m - 1] != 0.0) {
512                                for (int i = m + 1; i <= high; i++) {
513                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1];
514                                }
515                                for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
516                                        double g = 0.0;
517                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
518                                                g += ort[i] * V[i][j];
519                                        }
520                                        // Double division avoids possible underflow
521                                        g = (g / ort[m]) / H[m][m - 1];
522                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
523                                                V[i][j] += g * ort[i];
524                                        }
525                                }
526                        }
527                }
528        }
529
530//      // Complex scalar division.     // TODO: change to tuple return!
531//      private transient double cdivr, cdivi;
532//
533//      @Deprecated
534//      private void cdivOld(final double xr, final double xi, final double yr, final double yi) {
535//              double r, d;
536//              if (Math.abs(yr) > Math.abs(yi)) {
537//                      r = yi / yr;
538//                      d = yr + r * yi;
539//                      cdivr = (xr + r * xi) / d;
540//                      cdivi = (xi - r * xr) / d;
541//              } else {
542//                      r = yr / yi;
543//                      d = yi + r * yr;
544//                      cdivr = (r * xr + xi) / d;
545//                      cdivi = (r * xi - xr) / d;
546//              }
547//      }
548        
549    /**
550     * Performs a division of two complex numbers.
551     *
552     * @param xr real part of the first number
553     * @param xi imaginary part of the first number
554     * @param yr real part of the second number
555     * @param yi imaginary part of the second number
556     * @return result of the complex division
557     */
558    private Complex cdiv(final double xr, final double xi,
559                         final double yr, final double yi) {
560        return new Complex(xr, xi).divide(new Complex(yr, yi));
561    }
562
563        // Nonsymmetric reduction from Hessenberg to real Schur form.
564        private void hqr2() {
565                // This is derived from the Algol procedure hqr2,
566                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
567                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
568                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
569                
570                // Initialize
571                final int nn = this.n;
572                int n = nn - 1;
573                final int low = 0;
574                final int high = nn - 1;
575                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
576                double exshift = 0.0;
577                double p = 0, q = 0, r = 0, s = 0, z = 0, t, w, x, y;
578
579                // Store roots isolated by balanc and compute matrix norm
580                double norm = 0.0;
581                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
582                        if (i < low | i > high) {
583                                d[i] = H[i][i];
584                                e[i] = 0.0;
585                        }
586                        for (int j = Math.max(i - 1, 0); j < nn; j++) {
587                                norm = norm + Math.abs(H[i][j]);
588                        }
589                }
590
591                // Outer loop over eigenvalue index
592                int iter = 0;
593                while (n >= low) {
594                        // Look for single small sub-diagonal element
595                        int l = n;
596                        while (l > low) {
597                                s = Math.abs(H[l - 1][l - 1]) + Math.abs(H[l][l]);
598                                if (s == 0.0) {
599                                        s = norm;
600                                }
601                                if (Math.abs(H[l][l - 1]) < eps * s) {
602                                        break;
603                                }
604                                l--;
605                        }
606
607                        // Check for convergence
608                        // One root found
609                        if (l == n) {
610                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
611                                d[n] = H[n][n];
612                                e[n] = 0.0;
613                                n--;
614                                iter = 0;
615                                // Two roots found
616                        } else if (l == n - 1) {
617                                w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
618                                p = (H[n - 1][n - 1] - H[n][n]) / 2.0;
619                                q = p * p + w;
620                                z = Math.sqrt(Math.abs(q));
621                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
622                                H[n - 1][n - 1] = H[n - 1][n - 1] + exshift;
623                                x = H[n][n];
624
625                                // Real pair
626                                if (q >= 0) {
627                                        if (p >= 0) {
628                                                z = p + z;
629                                        } else {
630                                                z = p - z;
631                                        }
632                                        d[n - 1] = x + z;
633                                        d[n] = d[n - 1];
634                                        if (z != 0.0) {
635                                                d[n] = x - w / z;
636                                        }
637                                        e[n - 1] = 0.0;
638                                        e[n] = 0.0;
639                                        x = H[n][n - 1];
640                                        s = Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(z);
641                                        p = x / s;
642                                        q = z / s;
643                                        r = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q);
644                                        p = p / r;
645                                        q = q / r;
646
647                                        // Row modification
648                                        for (int j = n - 1; j < nn; j++) {
649                                                z = H[n - 1][j];
650                                                H[n - 1][j] = q * z + p * H[n][j];
651                                                H[n][j] = q * H[n][j] - p * z;
652                                        }
653
654                                        // Column modification
655                                        for (int i = 0; i <= n; i++) {
656                                                z = H[i][n - 1];
657                                                H[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * H[i][n];
658                                                H[i][n] = q * H[i][n] - p * z;
659                                        }
660
661                                        // Accumulate transformations
662                                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
663                                                z = V[i][n - 1];
664                                                V[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * V[i][n];
665                                                V[i][n] = q * V[i][n] - p * z;
666                                        }
667
668                                        // Complex pair
669                                } else {
670                                        d[n - 1] = x + p;
671                                        d[n] = x + p;
672                                        e[n - 1] = z;
673                                        e[n] = -z;
674                                }
675                                n = n - 2;
676                                iter = 0;
677                                // No convergence yet
678                        } else {
679                                // Form shift
680                                x = H[n][n];
681                                y = 0.0;
682                                w = 0.0;
683                                if (l < n) {
684                                        y = H[n - 1][n - 1];
685                                        w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
686                                }
687
688                                // Wilkinson's original ad hoc shift
689                                if (iter == 10) {
690                                        exshift += x;
691                                        for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
692                                                H[i][i] -= x;
693                                        }
694                                        s = Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) + Math.abs(H[n - 1][n - 2]);
695                                        x = y = 0.75 * s;
696                                        w = -0.4375 * s * s;
697                                }
698
699                                // MATLAB's new ad hoc shift
700                                if (iter == 30) {
701                                        s = (y - x) / 2.0;
702                                        s = s * s + w;
703                                        if (s > 0) {
704                                                s = Math.sqrt(s);
705                                                if (y < x) {
706                                                        s = -s;
707                                                }
708                                                s = x - w / ((y - x) / 2.0 + s);
709                                                for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
710                                                        H[i][i] -= s;
711                                                }
712                                                exshift += s;
713                                                x = y = w = 0.964;
714                                        }
715                                }
716
717                                iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
718
719                                // Look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements
720                                int m = n - 2;
721                                while (m >= l) {
722                                        z = H[m][m];
723                                        r = x - z;
724                                        s = y - z;
725                                        p = (r * s - w) / H[m + 1][m] + H[m][m + 1];
726                                        q = H[m + 1][m + 1] - z - r - s;
727                                        r = H[m + 2][m + 1];
728                                        s = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
729                                        p = p / s;
730                                        q = q / s;
731                                        r = r / s;
732                                        if (m == l) {
733                                                break;
734                                        }
735                                        if (Math.abs(H[m][m - 1]) * (Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r)) < eps
736                                                        * (Math.abs(p) * (Math.abs(H[m - 1][m - 1]) + Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(H[m + 1][m + 1])))) {
737                                                break;
738                                        }
739                                        m--;
740                                }
741
742                                for (int i = m + 2; i <= n; i++) {
743                                        H[i][i - 2] = 0.0;
744                                        if (i > m + 2) {
745                                                H[i][i - 3] = 0.0;
746                                        }
747                                }
748
749                                // Double QR step involving rows l:n and columns m:n
750                                for (int k = m; k <= n - 1; k++) {
751                                        final boolean notlast = (k != n - 1);
752                                        if (k != m) {
753                                                p = H[k][k - 1];
754                                                q = H[k + 1][k - 1];
755                                                r = (notlast ? H[k + 2][k - 1] : 0.0);
756                                                x = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
757                                                if (x != 0.0) {
758                                                        p = p / x;
759                                                        q = q / x;
760                                                        r = r / x;
761                                                }
762                                        }
763                                        if (x == 0.0) {
764                                                break;
765                                        }
766                                        s = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q + r * r);
767                                        if (p < 0) {
768                                                s = -s;
769                                        }
770                                        if (s != 0) {
771                                                if (k != m) {
772                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -s * x;
773                                                } else if (l != m) {
774                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -H[k][k - 1];
775                                                }
776                                                p = p + s;
777                                                x = p / s;
778                                                y = q / s;
779                                                z = r / s;
780                                                q = q / p;
781                                                r = r / p;
782
783                                                // Row modification
784
785                                                for (int j = k; j < nn; j++) {
786                                                        p = H[k][j] + q * H[k + 1][j];
787                                                        if (notlast) {
788                                                                p = p + r * H[k + 2][j];
789                                                                H[k + 2][j] = H[k + 2][j] - p * z;
790                                                        }
791                                                        H[k][j] = H[k][j] - p * x;
792                                                        H[k + 1][j] = H[k + 1][j] - p * y;
793                                                }
794
795                                                // Column modification
796
797                                                for (int i = 0; i <= Math.min(n, k + 3); i++) {
798                                                        p = x * H[i][k] + y * H[i][k + 1];
799                                                        if (notlast) {
800                                                                p = p + z * H[i][k + 2];
801                                                                H[i][k + 2] = H[i][k + 2] - p * r;
802                                                        }
803                                                        H[i][k] = H[i][k] - p;
804                                                        H[i][k + 1] = H[i][k + 1] - p * q;
805                                                }
806
807                                                // Accumulate transformations
808
809                                                for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
810                                                        p = x * V[i][k] + y * V[i][k + 1];
811                                                        if (notlast) {
812                                                                p = p + z * V[i][k + 2];
813                                                                V[i][k + 2] = V[i][k + 2] - p * r;
814                                                        }
815                                                        V[i][k] = V[i][k] - p;
816                                                        V[i][k + 1] = V[i][k + 1] - p * q;
817                                                }
818                                        } // (s != 0)
819                                } // k loop
820                        } // check convergence
821                } // while (n >= low)
822
823                // Backsubstitute to find vectors of upper triangular form
824
825                if (norm == 0.0) {
826                        return;
827                }
828
829                for (n = nn - 1; n >= 0; n--) {
830                        p = d[n];
831                        q = e[n];
832
833                        // Real vector
834                        if (q == 0) {
835                                int l = n;
836                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
837                                for (int i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
838                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
839                                        r = 0.0;
840                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
841                                                r = r + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
842                                        }
843                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
844                                                z = w;
845                                                s = r;
846                                        } else {
847                                                l = i;
848                                                if (e[i] == 0.0) {
849                                                        if (w != 0.0) {
850                                                                H[i][n] = -r / w;
851                                                        } else {
852                                                                H[i][n] = -r / (eps * norm);
853                                                        }
854
855                                                        // Solve real equations
856
857                                                } else {
858                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
859                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
860                                                        q = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i];
861                                                        t = (x * s - z * r) / q;
862                                                        H[i][n] = t;
863                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > Math.abs(z)) {
864                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-r - w * t) / x;
865                                                        } else {
866                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-s - y * t) / z;
867                                                        }
868                                                }
869
870                                                // Overflow control
871
872                                                t = Math.abs(H[i][n]);
873                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
874                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
875                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
876                                                        }
877                                                }
878                                        }
879                                }
880                                // Complex vector
881                        } else if (q < 0) {
882                                int l = n - 1;
883                                // Last vector component imaginary so matrix is triangular
884                                if (Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) > Math.abs(H[n - 1][n])) {
885                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = q / H[n][n - 1];
886                                        H[n - 1][n] = -(H[n][n] - p) / H[n][n - 1];
887                                } else {
888//                                      cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
889                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
890                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();        //cdivr;
891                                        H[n - 1][n] = cpx.getImaginary();               //cdivi;
892                                }
893                                H[n][n - 1] = 0.0;
894                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
895                                for (int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--) {
896                                        double ra, sa, vr, vi;
897                                        ra = 0.0;
898                                        sa = 0.0;
899                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
900                                                ra = ra + H[i][j] * H[j][n - 1];
901                                                sa = sa + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
902                                        }
903                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
904
905                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
906                                                z = w;
907                                                r = ra;
908                                                s = sa;
909                                        } else {
910                                                l = i;
911                                                if (e[i] == 0) {
912                                                        // cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
913                                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
914                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();    //cdivr;
915                                                        H[i][n] = cpx.getImaginary();   //cdivi;
916                                                } else {
917
918                                                        // Solve complex equations
919
920                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
921                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
922                                                        vr = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i] - q * q;
923                                                        vi = (d[i] - p) * 2.0 * q;
924                                                        if (vr == 0.0 & vi == 0.0) {
925                                                                vr = eps * norm * (Math.abs(w) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(y) + Math.abs(z));
926                                                        }
927//                                                      cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
928                                                        Complex cpx1 = cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
929                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx1.getReal();   //cdivr;
930                                                        H[i][n] = cpx1.getImaginary();  //cdivi;
931                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > (Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(q))) {
932                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = (-ra - w * H[i][n - 1] + q * H[i][n]) / x;
933                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-sa - w * H[i][n] - q * H[i][n - 1]) / x;
934                                                        } else {
935//                                                              cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
936                                                                Complex cpx2 = cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
937                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = cpx2.getReal();       //cdivr;
938                                                                H[i + 1][n] = cpx2.getImaginary();      //cdivi;
939                                                        }
940                                                }
941
942                                                // Overflow control
943
944                                                t = Math.max(Math.abs(H[i][n - 1]), Math.abs(H[i][n]));
945                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
946                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
947                                                                H[j][n - 1] = H[j][n - 1] / t;
948                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
949                                                        }
950                                                }
951                                        }
952                                }
953                        }
954                }
955
956                // Vectors of isolated roots
957                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
958                        if (i < low | i > high) {
959                                for (int j = i; j < nn; j++) {
960                                        V[i][j] = H[i][j];
961                                }
962                        }
963                }
964
965                // Back transformation to get eigenvectors of original matrix
966                for (int j = nn - 1; j >= low; j--) {
967                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
968                                z = 0.0;
969                                for (int k = low; k <= Math.min(j, high); k++) {
970                                        z = z + V[i][k] * H[k][j];
971                                }
972                                V[i][j] = z;
973                        }
974                }
975        }
976        
977        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
978        
979        public static void main(String[] args) {
980                double[][] M = 
981                        {{4455707.000000000, 16685.500000000, 17344.500000000, 142.000000000}, 
982                        {-951005821.436619800, -3525507.007042253, -4059917.288732395, -33371.000000000}, 
983                        {-997789920.901407700, -4059917.288732392, -3879630.838028166, -34689.000000000}, 
984                        {70029373562.509700000, 297685588.322852130, 314485277.997519970, 2949430.845070420}};
985                
986                {
987                        System.out.println("JAMA:");
988                        EigenvalueDecomposition ed = new EigenvalueDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(M));
989                        double[] evals = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
990                        PrintPrecision.set(9);
991                        System.out.println("evals = " + Matrix.toString(evals));
992                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
993                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
994                        System.out.println("det = " + ed.getDeterminant());
995                        
996                        // evals = {-753386.305449104, 115.864946503, 401745.451068664, 351524.989423574}
997                }
998                
999                {
1000                        System.out.println("Apache Commons Math:");
1001                        org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition  ed = 
1002                                        new org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(M));
1003                        double[] evals = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
1004                        PrintPrecision.set(9);
1005                        System.out.println("evals = " + Matrix.toString(evals));
1006                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1007                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1008                        System.out.println("det = " + ed.getDeterminant());
1009                        // evals = {-753386.305357033, 200930.657960727, 200930.657960727, 351524.989425229} - complex!
1010                }
1011        }
1012        
1013        
1014}
